I offer a variety of consulting services tailored to research institutions, NGOs, international organizations, and policymakers, aiming to support them in all stages of the data life cycle. I have provided my services as a consultant to the following organizations: - [Internal Displacement Monitoring Centre - Norwegian Refugee Council](https://www.internal-displacement.org/); - [Managing Exits from Armed Conflict - United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research](https://unidir.org/); - [Regional Office for Central America, North America and the Caribbean - International Organization for Migration](https://lac.iom.int/es); - [Global Centre of Excellence on Gender Statistics - UN Women](https://data.unwomen.org/where-we-work/cegs); and, - [Center of Excellence for Statistical Information on Government, Crime, Victimization and Justice - United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime](https://www.cdeunodc.inegi.org.mx/index.php/en/) :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"}

Research design

::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon=false} ## Read more + **Tasks include:** - Defining objectives, - Identifying the target population, - Designing indicators, - Developing survey questionnaires, and - Planning the sampling design. **Experience:** I have experience working with questionnaires on victimization experiences and perceptions of insecurity across various Latin American countries. Additionally, I have contributed to the design of surveys assessing the socioeconomic conditions of both displaced and non-displaced households in Sudan, as well as the experiences of individuals and families before, during, and after armed conflicts in Nigeria, Niger, Chad, Cameroon, and Iraq. **Example:** I helped organize the sampling design for the first national victimization survey of Panama [Read the document (only in Spanish)](https://siec.minseg.gob.pa/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Diseno-Muestral-de-la-ENVIP-2015.pdf). ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"}

Data management

::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon=false} ## Read more + **Tasks include:** - Identification of data sources; - Gathering data from various sources; - Cleaning, structuring, and transforming messy data into research-ready datasets; and, - Organizing and storing data. **Experience:** I have experience in data cleaning, as well as creating data dictionaries and metadata. Additionally, I have worked on integrating data from household surveys, administrative records, censuses, and remote sensing sources. When statistical information is unavailable, I have leveraged LLMs, web scraping, and text and data mining techniques to generate new datasets. **Example:** I am the author of the [global dataset of pandemic- and epidemic-prone disease outbreaks](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41597-022-01797-2), which earned the 2023 ENLIGHT Open Science Award and was a finalist for the Falling Walls Science Breakthroughs in Science & Innovation Management. Additionally, I led the data management and analysis of a survey conducted in 2022 across four key locations in Iraq previously occupied by ISIL. ::: ::: :::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"}

Statistical analysis

::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon=false} ## Read more + **Tasks include:** - Linear regression and nonlinear regression modeling; - Machine learning predictive modelling; - Disaggregated analyses; and, - Statistical tests to assess differences between populations. **Experience:** I have experience analyzing and interpreting data on victimization, gender-based violence, food security, income poverty, displacement, and armed conflict. Additionally, I have also developed and examined hard-to-measure phenomena such as indicators for severity assessments and perception of social networks. **Example:** At UNIDIR, I analyzed and co-authored five research papers on subjects such as [weapon holding](https://unidir.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/UNIDIR_Factors_Driving_Weapons_Holding_in_the_North_East_of_Nigeria_MEAC_Findings_Report_33.pdf), [child recruitment](https://unidir.org/publication/child-recruitment-in-the-lake-chad-basin-findings-report-22/), and [family reintegration in Iraq](https://unidir.org/publication/coming-home-the-return-and-reintegration-of-families-with-perceived-isil-affiliation-in-iraq-findings-report-28/). ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"}

Data visualization

::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon=false} ## Read more + **Tasks include:** - Building dynamic and interactive dashboards; and, - Custom data visualizations. **Experience:** I have experience developing dynamic R Shiny dashboards and creating interactive visualizations using ggplot2, tidyplots, and Leaflet. My work includes designing choropleth maps and tailored data visualizations for reports, presentations, and academic publications. **Example:** Go to the [Shiny Dashboard of the DISEASE OUTBREAKS DATA project](https://jatorresmunguia.shinyapps.io/A_global_dataset_of_disease_outbreaks/). At IOM, I contributed to developing a [PowerBI interactive dashboard for migration governance in Mesoamerica and the Caribbean](https://rosanjose.iom.int/en/interactive-dashboard-governance-migration-mesoamerica-and-caribbean). ::: ::: :::: ## Deliverables I am committed to reproducible research. Therefore, upon completing the consultancy, you will receive well-documented R scripts, along with R Markdown/Quarto files detailing each step of the work, clean datasets in the required format (Excel, CSV, SPSS, etc.), and/or an analytical report. ## Let’s collaborate If you need support with data management, statistical analysis, visualization, or team training on these tasks, feel free to reach out at [ja.torresmunguia@gmail.com](mailto:ja.torresmunguia@gmail.com)! Let's discuss how I can help you leverage your data for meaningful impact.
